Let <math display="inline">x \in \mathbb{R}\setminus \mathbb{Q}</math> and <math display="inline">\frac{p}{q} \in \mathbb{Q}</math>

Assume for the sake of contradiction that <math display="inline">x  +   \frac{p}{q} = \frac{m}{n}</math> where <math display="inline">\frac{m}{n} \in \mathbb{Q}</math> then <math display="inline">x = \frac{mq  -  pn }{nq} \in \mathbb{Q}</math> since <math display="inline">\mathbb{Q}</math> is closed under multiplication and addition/subtraction.
